description: The paper discusses the potential of detecting the Diffuse Supernova Neutrino Background (DSNB) at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO) through the inverse-beta-decay (IBD) detection channel on free protons. Using the latest DSNB flux predictions, the study evaluates background suppression and optimization techniques aiming to achieve significant detection sensitivity.

research_field.justification: The research focuses on studying astrophysical phenomena, specifically the detection of the diffuse supernova neutrino background.
research_field.quote: The diffuse supernova neutrino background (DSNB), which is the integrated neutrino signal from all the SN explosions in the Universe, is expected to be visible in large underground neutrino detectors.
